law.catch_line: Powers of cabinet in providing child welfare -- Local agencies.

text.section: The cabinet shall do all things necessary to execute the duties required by KRS 200.080 to 200.120, and may adopt necessary rules and regulations to carry out the provisions of KRS 200.080 to 200.120.
The cabinet may assist in the establishment of county children's bureaus, and shall cooperate with all agencies, institutions, and associations concerned with the welfare of children.

The cabinet may receive both real and personal property, by gift, devise, bequest, and conveyance, for the purpose of carrying out the provisions of KRS 200.080 to 200.120. The cabinet may expend out of funds so received such sums as are necessary for the treatment of children committed to its care.

law.history: Amended 1980 Ky. Acts ch. 188, sec. 189, effective July 15, 1980. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. secs. 331L-3, 331L-6, 331L-9, 331L-11.
